Events.text: Dong Zhuo has his troops evacuate the capital Luoyang and burn it to the ground.
Events.html: Dong Zhuo has his troops evacuate the capital Luoyang and burn it to the ground.

Events.text: Byzantine Emperor Basiliscus issues a circular letter (Enkyklikon) to the bishops of his empire, supporting the Monophysite christological position.
Events.html: Byzantine Emperor Basiliscus issues a circular letter (Enkyklikon) to the bishops of his empire, supporting the Monophysite christological position.

Events.text: Siege of Rome: The Byzantine general Belisarius receives his promised reinforcements, 1,600 cavalry, mostly of Hunnic or Slavic origin and expert bowmen. He starts, despite shortages, raids against the Gothic camps and Vitiges is forced into a stalemate.
Events.html: Siege of Rome: The Byzantine general Belisarius receives his promised reinforcements, 1,600 cavalry, mostly of Hunnic or Slavic origin and expert bowmen. He starts, despite shortages, raids against the Gothic camps and Vitiges is forced into a stalemate.

Events.text: Battle of Liegnitz: Mongol forces defeat the Polish and German armies.
Events.html: Battle of Liegnitz: Mongol forces defeat the Polish and German armies.

Events.text: Mongol invasions of Vietnam: Yuan forces are defeated by Trần forces in the Battle of Bach Dang in present-day northern Vietnam.
Events.html: Mongol invasions of Vietnam: Yuan forces are defeated by Trần forces in the Battle of Bach Dang in present-day northern Vietnam.

Events.text: Despite being outnumbered 16 to 1, forces of the Old Swiss Confederacy are victorious over the Archduchy of Austria in the Battle of Näfels.
Events.html: Despite being outnumbered 16 to 1, forces of the Old Swiss Confederacy are victorious over the Archduchy of Austria in the Battle of Näfels.

Events.text: Henry V is crowned King of England.
Events.html: Henry V is crowned King of England.

Events.text: Christopher of Bavaria is appointed King of Denmark.
Events.html: Christopher of Bavaria is appointed King of Denmark.

Events.text: The Treaty of Lodi is signed, establishing a balance of power among northern Italian city-states for almost 50 years.
Events.html: The Treaty of Lodi is signed, establishing a balance of power among northern Italian city-states for almost 50 years.

Events.text: St John's College, Cambridge, England, founded by Lady Margaret Beaufort, receives its charter.
Events.html: St John's College, Cambridge, England, founded by Lady Margaret Beaufort, receives its charter.

Events.text: The expedition organised by Sir Walter Raleigh departs England for Roanoke Island (now in North Carolina) to establish the Roanoke Colony.
Events.html: The expedition organised by Sir Walter Raleigh departs England for Roanoke Island (now in North Carolina) to establish the Roanoke Colony.

Events.text: Eighty Years' War: Spain and the Dutch Republic sign the Treaty of Antwerp to initiate twelve years of truce.
Events.html: Eighty Years' War: Spain and the Dutch Republic sign the Treaty of Antwerp to initiate twelve years of truce.

Events.text: Robert Cavelier de La Salle discovers the mouth of the Mississippi River, claims it for France and names it Louisiana.
Events.html: Robert Cavelier de La Salle discovers the mouth of the Mississippi River, claims it for France and names it Louisiana.

links.title: René-Robert Cavelier, Sieur de La Salle

Events.text: American War of Independence: Battle of the Saintes begins.
Events.html: American War of Independence: Battle of the Saintes begins.

Events.text: On his phonautograph machine, Édouard-Léon Scott de Martinville makes the oldest known recording of an audible human voice.
Events.html: On his phonautograph machine, Édouard-Léon Scott de Martinville makes the oldest known recording of an audible human voice.

Events.text: American Civil War: Robert E. Lee surrenders the Army of Northern Virginia (26,765 troops) to Ulysses S. Grant at Appomattox Courthouse, Virginia, effectively ending the war.
Events.html: American Civil War: Robert E. Lee surrenders the Army of Northern Virginia (26,765 troops) to Ulysses S. Grant at Appomattox Courthouse, Virginia, effectively ending the war.

Events.text: The U.S. Congress passes the Payne–Aldrich Tariff Act.
Events.html: The U.S. Congress passes the Payne–Aldrich Tariff Act.

Events.text: Mexican Revolution: One of the world's first naval/air skirmishes takes place off the coast of western Mexico.
Events.html: Mexican Revolution: One of the world's first naval/air skirmishes takes place off the coast of western Mexico.

Events.text: World War I: The Battle of Verdun: German forces launch their third offensive of the battle.
Events.html: World War I: The Battle of Verdun: German forces launch their third offensive of the battle.

Events.text: World War I: The Battle of Arras: The battle begins with Canadian Corps executing a massive assault on Vimy Ridge.
Events.html: World War I: The Battle of Arras: The battle begins with Canadian Corps executing a massive assault on Vimy Ridge.

Events.text: World War I: The Battle of the Lys: The Portuguese Expeditionary Corps is crushed by the German forces during what is called the Spring Offensive on the Belgian region of Flanders.
Events.html: World War I: The Battle of the Lys: The Portuguese Expeditionary Corps is crushed by the German forces during what is called the Spring Offensive on the Belgian region of Flanders.

Events.text: The National Council of Bessarabia proclaims union with the Kingdom of Romania.
Events.html: 1918 – The National Council of Bessarabia proclaims union with the Kingdom of Romania.

Events.text: The Kamikaze arrives at Croydon Airport in London. It is the first Japanese-built aircraft to fly to Europe.
Events.html: The Kamikaze arrives at Croydon Airport in London. It is the first Japanese-built aircraft to fly to Europe.

Events.text: Marian Anderson sings at the Lincoln Memorial, after being denied the right to sing at the Daughters of the American Revolution's Constitution Hall.
Events.html: Marian Anderson sings at the Lincoln Memorial, after being denied the right to sing at the Daughters of the American Revolution's Constitution Hall.

Events.text: World War II: Operation Weserübung: Germany invades Denmark and Norway.
Events.html: World War II: Operation Weserübung: Germany invades Denmark and Norway.

Events.text: Vidkun Quisling seizes power in Norway.
Events.html: 1940 – Vidkun Quisling seizes power in Norway.

Events.text: World War II: The Battle of Bataan/Bataan Death March: United States forces surrender on the Bataan Peninsula. The Japanese Navy launches an air raid on Trincomalee in Ceylon (Sri Lanka); Royal Navy aircraft carrier HMS Hermes and Royal Australian Navy Destroyer HMAS Vampire are sunk off the island's east coast.
Events.html: World War II: The Battle of Bataan/Bataan Death March: United States forces surrender on the Bataan Peninsula. The Japanese Navy launches an air raid on Trincomalee in Ceylon (Sri Lanka); Royal Navy aircraft carrier HMS Hermes and Royal Australian Navy Destroyer HMAS Vampire are sunk off the island's east coast.

Events.text: World War II: The German pocket battleship Admiral Scheer is sunk by the Royal Air Force
Events.html: World War II: The German pocket battleship Admiral Scheer is sunk by the Royal Air Force

Events.text: World War II: The Battle of Königsberg, in East Prussia, ends.
Events.html: 1945 – World War II: The Battle of Königsberg, in East Prussia, ends.

Events.text: The United States Atomic Energy Commission is formed.
Events.html: 1945 – The United States Atomic Energy Commission is formed.

Events.text: The Glazier–Higgins–Woodward tornadoes kill 181 and injure 970 in Texas, Oklahoma, and Kansas.
Events.html: The Glazier–Higgins–Woodward tornadoes kill 181 and injure 970 in Texas, Oklahoma, and Kansas.

Events.text: The Journey of Reconciliation, the first interracial Freedom Ride begins through the upper South in violation of Jim Crow laws. The riders wanted enforcement of the United States Supreme Court's 1946 Irene Morgan decision that banned racial segregation in interstate travel.
Events.html: 1947 – The Journey of Reconciliation, the first interracial Freedom Ride begins through the upper South in violation of Jim Crow laws. The riders wanted enforcement of the United States Supreme Court's 1946 Irene Morgan decision that banned racial segregation in interstate travel.

Events.text: The United Nations Security Council Resolution 22 is adopted.
Events.html: 1947 – The United Nations Security Council Resolution 22 is adopted.

Events.text: Jorge Eliécer Gaitán's assassination provokes a violent riot in Bogotá (the Bogotazo), and a further ten years of violence in Colombia.
Events.html: Jorge Eliécer Gaitán's assassination provokes a violent riot in Bogotá (the Bogotazo), and a further ten years of violence in Colombia.

Events.text: Fighters from the Irgun and Lehi Zionist paramilitary groups attacked Deir Yassin near Jerusalem, killing over 100.
Events.html: 1948 – Fighters from the Irgun and Lehi Zionist paramilitary groups attacked Deir Yassin near Jerusalem, killing over 100.

Events.text: Hugo Ballivián's government is overthrown by the Bolivian National Revolution, starting a period of agrarian reform, universal suffrage and the nationalization of tin mines
Events.html: Hugo Ballivián's government is overthrown by the Bolivian National Revolution, starting a period of agrarian reform, universal suffrage and the nationalization of tin mines

Events.text: The Suez Canal in Egypt is cleared and opens to shipping.
Events.html: The Suez Canal in Egypt is cleared and opens to shipping.

Events.text: Project Mercury: NASA announces the selection of the United States' first seven astronauts, whom the news media quickly dub the "Mercury Seven".
Events.html: Project Mercury: NASA announces the selection of the United States' first seven astronauts, whom the news media quickly dub the "Mercury Seven".

Events.text: Dr. Hendrik Verwoerd, Prime Minister of South Africa and architect of apartheid, narrowly survives an assassination attempt by a white farmer called David Pratt in Johannesburg.
Events.html: Dr. Hendrik Verwoerd, Prime Minister of South Africa and architect of apartheid, narrowly survives an assassination attempt by a white farmer called David Pratt in Johannesburg.

Events.text: The Pacific Electric Railway in Los Angeles, once the largest electric railway in the world, ends operations.
Events.html: The Pacific Electric Railway in Los Angeles, once the largest electric railway in the world, ends operations.

Events.text: Astrodome opens. First indoor baseball game is played.
Events.html: Astrodome opens. First indoor baseball game is played.

Events.text: The first Boeing 737 (a 100 series) makes its maiden flight.
Events.html: The first Boeing 737 (a 100 series) makes its maiden flight.

Events.text: The first British-built Concorde 002 makes its maiden flight from Filton to RAF Fairford.
Events.html: The first British-built Concorde 002 makes its maiden flight from Filton to RAF Fairford.

Events.text: The first game of the Philippine Basketball Association, the second oldest professional basketball league in the world.
Events.html: The first game of the Philippine Basketball Association, the second oldest professional basketball league in the world.

Events.text: Eight people in South Korea, who are involved in People's Revolutionary Party Incident, are hanged.
Events.html: 1975 – Eight people in South Korea, who are involved in People's Revolutionary Party Incident, are hanged.

Events.text: The Iraqi regime of Saddam Hussein kills philosopher Muhammad Baqir al-Sadr and his sister Bint al-Huda after three days of torture.
Events.html: The Iraqi regime of Saddam Hussein kills philosopher Muhammad Baqir al-Sadr and his sister Bint al-Huda after three days of torture.

Events.text: The U.S. Navy nuclear submarine USS George Washington accidentally collides with the Nissho Maru, a Japanese cargo ship, sinking it.
Events.html: The U.S. Navy nuclear submarine USS George Washington accidentally collides with the Nissho Maru, a Japanese cargo ship, sinking it.

Events.text: The April 9 tragedy in Tbilisi, Georgian Soviet Socialist Republic, an anti-Soviet peaceful demonstration and hunger strikes, demanding restoration of Georgian independence is dispersed by the Soviet Army, resulting in 20 deaths and hundreds of injuries.
Events.html: The April 9 tragedy in Tbilisi, Georgian Soviet Socialist Republic, an anti-Soviet peaceful demonstration and hunger strikes, demanding restoration of Georgian independence is dispersed by the Soviet Army, resulting in 20 deaths and hundreds of injuries.

Events.text: Georgia declares independence from the Soviet Union
Events.html: Georgia declares independence from the Soviet Union

Events.text: A U.S. Federal Court finds former Panamanian dictator Manuel Noriega guilty of drug and racketeering charges. He is sentenced to 30 years in prison.
Events.html: A U.S. Federal Court finds former Panamanian dictator Manuel Noriega guilty of drug and racketeering charges. He is sentenced to 30 years in prison.

Events.text: Kosovo War: The Battle of Košare begins.
Events.html: Kosovo War: The Battle of Košare begins.

Events.text: Iraq War: Baghdad falls to American forces; Iraqis turn on symbols of their former leader Saddam Hussein, pulling down a grand statue of him and tearing it to pieces.
Events.html: Iraq War: Baghdad falls to American forces; Iraqis turn on symbols of their former leader Saddam Hussein, pulling down a grand statue of him and tearing it to pieces.

Events.text: Charles, Prince of Wales marries Camilla Parker Bowles in a civil ceremony at Windsor's Guildhall.
Events.html: Charles, Prince of Wales marries Camilla Parker Bowles in a civil ceremony at Windsor's Guildhall.

links.title: Wedding of Charles, Prince of Wales, and Camilla Parker Bowles

Events.text: In Tbilisi, Georgia, up to 60,000 people protest against the government of Mikheil Saakashvili.
Events.html: In Tbilisi, Georgia, up to 60,000 people protest against the government of Mikheil Saakashvili.

Events.text: A 6.1–magnitude earthquake strikes Iran killing 32 people and injuring over 850 people.
Events.html: A 6.1–magnitude earthquake strikes Iran killing 32 people and injuring over 850 people.

Events.text: At least 13 people are killed and another three injured after a man goes on a spree shooting in the Serbian village of Velika Ivanča.
Events.html: 2013 – At least 13 people are killed and another three injured after a man goes on a spree shooting in the Serbian village of Velika Ivanča.

Events.text: A student stabs 20 people at Franklin Regional High School in Murrysville, Pennsylvania.
Events.html: A student stabs 20 people at Franklin Regional High School in Murrysville, Pennsylvania.
